Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, ternary ion solution of KCl, MgCl2, and LiCl
Other Information.Additional Info: K+ exhibits the highest permeability due to its smallest hydration diameter and favorable binding affinity with sulfonate groups.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, ternary ion solution of KCl, MgCl2, and LiCl
Other Information.Additional Info: Li+ shows intermediate permeability due to its larger hydration diameter compared to K+ and weaker binding affinity with sulfonate groups.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, ternary ion solution of KCl, MgCl2, and LiCl
Other Information.Additional Info: Mg2+ exhibits the lowest permeability due to its largest hydration diameter and strongest binding affinity with sulfonate groups, hindering transport through the membrane.

Sieving Mechanism: Combined effects of size-sieving and binding affinity for selective ion transport.

Experimental Validation.Method: Ion permeation experiment using a homemade U-shaped device and ICP-OES analysis
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: K+/Mg2+ selectivity: 207.7, K+/Li+ selectivity: 8.3 at pH = 2

Other Information.Additional Info: The GO/ZS/MOF membrane demonstrates high structural stability in different aqueous media and harsh chemical environments, making it suitable for applications such as extracting potassium from salt lake brine.
